misdeed: Travelers passing near a remote lake have gone missing. Their belongings are often found scattered by the roadside, but their bodies are never recovered.
solution: The Vaesen is a Brook Horse and can be banished by riding it across plowed ground in the shape of a sun cross or leading it into a stable marked with six Christian symbols.

clues.description: Witnesses report seeing a magnificent white stallion with a flowing mane near the lake shortly before the disappearances began.
The hoofprints discovered near the site of the missing persons' belongings are abnormally large and seem to vanish into thin air.
Local legends speak of a water spirit that takes the form of a horse and lures unsuspecting travelers to their deaths.
Fishermen report an unsettling silence from the lake. The once abundant fish have seemingly vanished.
A child's toy horse is found among the belongings of one of the missing persons. Its eyes are a piercing blue, unlike any horse in the area.
The water of the lake appears unusually still and dark, as if something lurks beneath its surface.

plotTwist.description: A local stablehand, spurned by a love interest who went missing, is secretly caring for the Vaesen and using it to enact revenge on those he deems responsible for his heartbreak.
